3. ■ Indicates a written question transferred for oral reply upon the request of the relevant
member (Rule 117).

INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: QUESTIONS FOR ORAL REPLY
WEDNESDAY, 24 APRIL 2013
DEPUTY PRESIDENT

page.text: Ms L L van der Merwe (IFP) (p 229)—Deputy President.
Mr J J McGluwa (ID) (p 229)—Deputy President.
Ms B T Ngcobo (ANC) (p 229)—Deputy President.
The Leader of the Opposition (DA) (p 230)—Deputy President.

text.b: QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN REPLY
FRIDAY, 19 APRIL 2013
Mr M Waters (DA) to ask the Minister of Justice and Constitutional Development:

page.text: How many persons have been found to be unsuitable to work with children (a) in the
(i) 2010-11 and (ii) 2011-12 financial years and (b) since 1 April 2013;
how many of the abovementioned persons’ particulars were sent to the Department
of Social Development for inclusion in the Child Protection Register?
NW748E

text.b: Mr M Waters (DA) to ask the Minister of Social Development:

page.text: Since the inception of the Zero Hunger Programme, how much has been (a) allocated and
(b) spent in each financial year up to the latest specified date for which information is
available?
NW749E

text.b: Mrs J F Terblance (DA) to ask the Minister of Transport:

page.text: Whether his department holds statistics on (a) how many vehicles were (i) weighed, (ii)
overweight and (iii) issued with a fine and (b) the total amount in fines that were issued at
all weighbridges since 1 January 2010?
NW779E

text.b: Adv A de W Alberts (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:†

page.text: Whether he is aware that the shareholders agreement between Eskom and the Government
does not meet the requirements as stipulated in section 6(5)(b) of the Eskom Conversion
Act, Act 13 of 2001, because the shareholders agreement does not make provision for the
provision of affordable electricity, as required by section 6(5)(b); if not, what is he planning
to do to correct this error; if so, why were the requirements not met?
NW817E
239 [Friday, 19 April 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Dr C P Mulder (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:†

page.text: How many new single medium schools were established for each of the 11 official
languages (a) in (i) 2009, (ii) 2010, (iii) 2011 and (iv) 2012 and (b) since 1 January
(a) how many single medium schools for each of the 11 official languages were
closed (i) in (aa) 2009, (bb) 2010, (cc) 2011 and (dd) 2012 and (ii) since 1 January
2013, (b) for which official languages in each case was provision made at these
schools and (c) why were the specified schools closed in each case;
(a) how many new dual medium schools were established (i) in (aa) 2009, (bb) 2010,
(cc) 2011 and (dd) 2012 and (ii) since 1 January 2013 and (b) for which official
languages in each case is provision made at these schools;
(a) how many dual medium schools were closed (i) in (aa) 2009, (bb) 2010, (cc)
2011 and (dd) 2012 and (ii) since 1 January 2013, (b) for which official languages in
each case was provision made at these schools and (c) why were the specified
schools closed in each case;
whether pupils who have been affected by the closing of schools have been placed in
schools that provide tuition in the same languages as the schools that have been
closed; if not, (a) why not and (b) how many pupils have found themselves in such a
situation?
NW820E

text.b: Mr N J J van R Koornhof (Cope) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: Whether her department intends to pilot a programme for the development of debating at
school level, similar to other Southern African Development Community (SADC) countries;
if not, why not?
NW832E

text.b: 678. Mr N J J van R Koornhof (Cope) to ask the Minister of Higher Education and
Training:

page.text: Whether his department intends to pilot a programme for the development of debating at
university level, similar to other Southern African Development Community (SADC)
countries; if not, why not?
NW833E

text.b: Mr M M Swathe (DA) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and Traditional
Affairs:

page.text: (a) What has been the annual total cost of expenditure on the maintenance of public parks
since 2010 and (b) in each case, what is the breakdown of expenditure per park?
NW836E

text.b: 680. Mr P J Groenewald (FF Plus) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs:†

page.text: What is the total outstanding amount which has been owed to Eskom for a period of
(a) 90 days, (b) 60 days, (c) 30 days and (d) longer than 90 days by all municipalities
in (i) North West, (ii) Free State, (iii) Mpumalanga en (iv) Eastern Cape;
Friday, 19 April 2013] 240
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013
what is currently the total amount due for outstanding service fees by state
departments to each such municipality;
whether he will make a statement on the matter?
NW838E

text.b: Mr R B Bhoola (MF) to ask the Minister of Social Development:

page.text: Whether her department has taken steps to conclude and finalise the mainstreaming of
gender rights, the rights of persons with disabilities and children’s rights at Cabinet level; if
not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW839E

text.b: Mr R B Bhoola (MF) to ask the Minister of Social Development:

page.text: Has the facilitation of public-private partnership pertaining to persons with disabilities been
realised; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW840E

text.b: Mrs C Dudley (ACDP) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: Whether she responded to accusations by the SA Democratic Teachers' Union that she
undermines collective bargaining?
NW849E

text.b: Mrs C Dudley (ACDP) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: What measures were put in place to ensure that a national go-slow by the SA
Democratic Teachers′ Union (SADTU) members scheduled from Tuesday, 9 April
2013, did not impact on learners negatively;
will supplementary examinations that were written in February be affected in terms
of being marked;
whether this action is related to a government proposal that education be made an
essential service, making it unlawful for teachers to strike; if not, what is the position
in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW850E

text.b: Mr J F Smalle (DA) to ask the Minister for Public Enterprises:

page.text: With reference to his reply to question 645 on 9 March 2013, how many legal claims
were instituted against his department (a) in the (i) 2007-08, (ii) 2008-09, (iii) 2009-
10, (iv) 2010-11 and (v) 2011-12 financial years and (b) during the period 1 April
2012 up to the latest specified date for which information is available;
in respect of each specified financial year, (a) what amount was claimed, (b) how
many claims were (i) finalised in court, (iii) settled out of court and (iii) are still
outstanding and (b) what amount has been paid to each plaintiff in each case that was
finalised (i) in court and (ii) settled out of court?
NW851E
241 [Friday, 19 April 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: 686. Mrs J C Moloi-Moropa (ANC) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and
Administration:

page.text: Whether she intends to re-assert
the State Information Technology Agency (Sita) as a
favourable provider of choice for all government departments; if not, why not; if so, how
does she intend to deal with the (a) high costing and (b) efficiency thereof?
NW852E

text.b: 687. Mrs J C Moloi-Moropa (ANC) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and
Administration:

page.text: Whether her department abandoned or discontinued the practice and concept of Batho Pele
as a fully entrenched and institutionalised programme of the Public Service; if not, what
strategies are in place to revive this practice; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW853E

text.b: 688. Mrs J C Moloi-Moropa (ANC) to ask the Minister in the Presidency: Performance
Monitoring and Evaluation as well as Administration in the Presidency:

page.text: How many Thusong Service Centres are functional in the rural areas;
whether departments are collaborating effectively for the viability of these centres in
these areas; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW854E

text.b: 689. Mrs D M Ramodibe (ANC) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and
Administration:

page.text: What programmes and budget are in place to benefit and transform the lives of (a) women
and (b) persons with disabilities?
NW855E

text.b: 690. Mrs D M Ramodibe (ANC) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and
Administration:

page.text: What progress has been made in her department to meet the 2% target of employment of
persons with disabilities?
NW856E

text.b: 691. Mrs D M Ramodibe (ANC) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs:

page.text: What are the current numbers/statistics for women’s representation in decision-making
positions in local government?
NW857E

Traditional Affairs: [
105] [Question submitted for oral reply now placed for written
reply because in excess of quota [Rule 108(8)]]

page.text: How does he ensure that issues of gender are taken into account when appointments
are made at local government level;
whether he took any steps to assist with the establishment of gender policies in (a)
provinces and (b) municipalities; if not, what is the position in this regard, in each
case; if so, what are the relevant details, in each case?
NW858E

Administration: [
108] [Question submitted for oral reply now placed for written
reply because in excess of quota [Rule 108(8)]]

page.text: When will her department’s clean-up of the Persal system in the Public Service, in
collaboration with the National Treasury, be (a) fully realised and (b) completed?
NW861E

text.b: 694. Mr L Ramatlakane (Cope) to ask the Minister of Justice and Constitutional
Development:

page.text: Whether all the departments have implemented the Promotion of Administrative Justice Act,
Act 3 of 2000, to galvanise the fight against corruption by promoting transparency and
accountability; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW874E

text.b: 695. Mr L Ramatlakane (Cope) to ask the Minister in the Presidency: Performance
Monitoring and Evaluation as well as Administration in the Presidency:

page.text: Whether, with reference to the Management Performance Assessment Tool (MPAT) report
on results of assessment process for 2011-12, there are any measures in place to monitor the
standard of policies and systems to ensure professional ethics in the 71% of departments that
are being less than fully compliant; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW876E

text.b: 696. Ms C K K Mosimane (Cope) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs: [
124] [Question submitted for oral reply now placed for written
reply because in excess of quota [Rule 108(8)]]

page.text: Whether he was informed that the merger of Sasolburg and Parys will go ahead despite the
2016 timeline; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW880E

text.b: 697. Mr J M Matshoba (ANC) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs: [
125] [Question submitted for oral reply now placed for written
reply because in excess of quota [Rule 108(8)]]

page.text: Whether the
Commission on Traditional Leadership Disputes and Claims
that deals with
disputes and claims on traditional leadership has settled all the cases lodged; if not, what is
the status of each such (a) dispute and (b) claim that has not been settled in each province; if
so, what are the relevant details of each (i) dispute and (ii) claim that has been settled in
each province?
NW884E

Traditional Affairs: [
127] [Question submitted for oral reply now placed for written
reply because in excess of quota [Rule 108(8)]]

page.text: Whether he has put any measures in place to avoid the Demarcation Process Review Task
Team encroaching on the mandate of the Municipal Demarcation Board; if not, why not; if
so, what are the relevant details?
NW886E

129] [Question submitted for oral reply now placed for written
reply because in excess of quota [Rule 108(8)]]

page.text: Whether he will update the National Assembly on the situation in Madibeng?

130] [Question submitted for oral reply now placed for written

page.text: What has been his findings on the state of municipalities in the country since the adoption of
the Local Government Turnaround Strategy?
NW889E

text.b: 701. Mr L Ramatlakane (Cope) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and
Administration:

page.text: What are the current qualifications and experience breakdown of the training
agencies that were established to deal with skills shortages and to enhance job
opportunities;
when were they last monitored and evaluated;
whether the specified agencies are accountable for the allocation of bursaries;
(3) whether
any
irregularities
were reported in the 2011-12 financial year; if so, what
action was taken?
NW891E

text.b: 702. Ms C K K Mosimane (Cope) to ask the Minister of Women, Children and People with
Disabilities:

page.text: Whether there is a building compliance readiness report or register which indicates
to what degree current state-owned facilities are disabled friendly;
whether sufficient systems are in place to (a) secure such data and (b) ensure the
ability to exit these facilities; if not, why not?
NW892E

text.b: 703. Ms C K K Mosimane (Cope) to ask the Minister of Women, Children and People with
Disabilities:

page.text: In compliance with the country and global obligation to people with disabilities, (a)
how far and (b) how beneficial is the Integrated National Disability Strategy for all
institutions in South Africa, (c) what difficulties confront people with disabilities to
access training and skills development and (d) what has she found to be the best
ways to overcome these difficulties, if any;
whether there is a plan of action to improve on the successes to date; if not, why not?
NW893E
Friday, 19 April 2013] 244
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: 704. Ms C K K Mosimane (Cope) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs:

page.text: Whether, with reference to the Auditor-General's report on the audit outcomes of local
government, he has taken any steps to engage municipalities regarding (a) officials who
were found to be incompetent, corrupt or abusing power, (b) filling vacancies with
competent officials, (c) building capacity in local municipalities and (d) establishing time
frames for the specified matters to be in place; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant
details?
NW895E

text.b: 705. Mrs J D Kilian (Cope) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and Administration:
132] [Question submitted for oral reply now placed for written reply because in
excess of quota [Rule 108(8)]]

page.text: How does she intend to implement, administer and monitor the biometric register to
crack down on teacher absenteeism;
has any settlement been reached with the SA Democratic Teachers' Union (Sadtu)
and other teacher unions about corrective measures to be taken against repeat
defaulters?
NW896E

text.b: 706. Mr A R Ainslie (ANC) to ask the Minister for the Public Service and Administration:
137] [Question submitted for oral reply now placed for written reply because in
excess of quota [Rule 108(8)]]

page.text: What measures are being taken by her department to professionalise the Public Service to
ensure that it will be able to deliver on the goals of the National Development Plan?
NW902E

text.b: 707. Dr C P Mulder (FF Plus) to ask the Minister in the Presidency: Performance
Monitoring and Evaluation as well as Administration in the Presidency:

page.text: Why, after seven years, has no progress been made in finalising the Presidential
Handbook, in spite of it being discussed among Government officials and their
political heads, as stated (details furnished) by the deputy information officer (name
furnished) in the Presidency;
who are the (a) Government officials and (b) political heads to whom the
spokesperson in the Presidency is referring;
whether he intends to take steps to ensure a more speedy conclusion to this process;
if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW911E

text.b: Adv A de W Alberts (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Transport:

page.text: Why is the investment and development programme of Transnet and the Passenger
Rail Agency of South Africa (Prasa) allowed R341 billion without his department
having a national policy on railway lines or an integrated transport policy at its
disposal to guide this investment and development programme;
245 [Friday, 19 April 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013
whether the shareholders of Transnet and Prasa have approved the investment and
development programme; if so, (a) when and (b) in what form; if not,
whether Transnet and Prasa are acting contrary to the will of their shareholders; if so,
what are the relevant details in this regard?
NW912E

text.b: 709. Adv A de W Alberts (FF Plus) to ask the Minister in the Presidency: Performance
Monitoring and Evaluation as well as Administration in the Presidency:

page.text: When will the report of the Presidential Review Committee on State-owned Enterprises,
which is currently with the Cabinet, be made available?
NW913E

text.b: Mr M S F de Freitas (DA) to ask the Minister of Home Affairs:

page.text: (a) How many victims of trafficking were (i) identified and (ii) returned to their
country of origin (aa) in the (aaa) 2010-11 and (bbb) 2011-12 financial years and
(bb) since 1 January 2013 and (b) to which countries were they returned;
(a) how were these victims processed respectively, (b) what is the current status of
each case and (c) what were the reasons for each victim being trafficked?
NW915E

text.b: Mr M S F de Freitas (DA) to ask the Minister of Home Affairs:

page.text: Since the inception of her department’s Learning Academy, what was its (a) budget
and (b) actual expenditure in each financial year;
(a) what courses are offered at the academy and (b) how many students have
completed each course in each financial year since the inception of the academy;
(a) how are students evaluated in terms of their respective understanding of the
material presented and (b) what (i) monitoring and (ii) evaluation processes exist to
evaluate the effectiveness of each course?
NW916E

text.b: Mr M S F de Freitas (DA) to ask the Minister of Home Affairs:

page.text: What is the proposed timeline for bringing the Electoral Act, Act 73 of 1998, and the
regulations thereof in line with the Richter judgment?
NW917E

text.b: Ms D Kohler-Barnard (DA) to ask the Minister of Police:

page.text: Is a certain official (name furnished) of the Directorate for Priority Crime
Investigation (Hawks) still employed by the SA Police Service; if so, is he (a) on
suspension and (b) still on full pay;
how much has he received in remuneration since the beginning of his suspension
period?
NW919E
Friday, 19 April 2013] 246
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Mrs D Robinson (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: What national system is in place to record absenteeism of medical staff at hospitals?
NW920E

text.b: Mrs D Robinson (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: How many man days were lost due to absenteeism in each province for (a) doctors and (b)
nurses?
NW921E

text.b: Mrs D Robinson (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: How many cases of litigation have been instituted against hospitals on the grounds of
negligence caused by medical staff shortages (a) in (i) 2010, (ii) 2011 and (iii) 2012 and (b)
since 1 January 2013?
NW922E

text.b: Mr D C Smiles (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: What support will her department provide towards the International Mathematical Olympiad
that will take place in the country this year?
NW923E

text.b: Dr A Lotriet (DA) to ask the Minister of Higher Education and Training:

page.text: What (a) was the amount and (b) were the reasons for the unspent funding of the National
Student Financial Aid Scheme of South Africa (NSFAS) at the Nelson Mandela
Metropolitan University?
NW924E

text.b: Dr A Lotriet (DA) to ask the Minister of Higher Education and Training:

page.text: Whether the Central Application Clearing House (CACH) has been outsourced; if so,
which company was awarded the contract;
whether the specified contract was put out to tender; if so, what are the relevant
details;
what is the (a) duration and (b) cost of the contract;
whether the specified contract includes the Central Application System?
NW925E

text.b: Mrs D A Schäfer (DA) to ask the Minister of Police:

page.text: What is the status of the investigation by the Directorate for Priority Crime
Investigation into the so-called brown envelope and Hip Hop case (details furnished);
has the investigation been finalised; if so, what are the relevant details; if not, what
are the reasons for the delay in finalising the case;
whether the docket has been referred to the Director of Public Prosecutions in (a)
Cape Town or (b) any other office; if not, why not; if so, (i) when, (ii) by whom and
(iii) to whom;
247 [Friday, 19 April 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013
has a CAS number been allocated to this investigation; if so, what is the number; if
not, why not?
NW926E

text.b: Mrs A T Lovemore (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: Whether, with regard to learners who have previously been progressed through a grade
in the further education and training phase and do not meet the promotion criteria for
grade 12, there are any no-fee, part-time study opportunities available through provincial
education departments to allow these learners to attain the promotional requirements; if
not, (a) why not and (b) what will be done to rectify the situation;
whether she intends to define any certificated exit points from the schooling system,
other than grade 12; if not, why has she decided, specifically, against certificating grade
what recourse is available to a learner who wishes to attend a further education and
training college post grade 9, but who is progressed, rather than promoted, through grade
9, and who has already been progressed through another grade in the senior phase?
NW927E

text.b: Mrs A T Lovemore (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: How many fraudulent certificates have been detected accompanying the applications
for registration as teachers submitted to the SA Council for Educators (SACE) for the
for each year, how many of the fraudulent certificates were submitted by (a) South
African citizens and (b) foreign citizens;
what measures does the SACE have in place to ascertain the veracity or otherwise of
certificates submitted to the council;
what action has been taken in the event of a fraudulent certificate being detected?
NW928E

text.b: Mrs A T Lovemore (DA) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: Whether she ensures that (a) the (i) national and (ii) provincial departments of
education and (b) every (i) district and (ii) school comply with all (aa) requirements
of the Occupational Health and Safety Act, Act 85 of 1993 and (bb) regulations
gazetted in terms of the specified Act; if not, why not; if so, what are the details of
the compliance measures that are in place;
whether she ensures that (a) the (i) national and (ii) provincial departments of
education and (b) every (i) district and (ii) school comply with all (aa) requirements
of the Compensation for Occupational Injuries and Diseases Act, Act 130 of 1993,
and (bb) regulations gazetted in terms of the specified Act; if not, why not; if so,
what are the details of the compliance measures that are in place;
for each Act mentioned above, which programme and/or directorate within her
department assumes responsibility for (a) implementation and (b) oversight?
NW929E
Friday, 19 April 2013] 248
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Ms A M Dreyer (DA) to ask the Minister of Public Works:

page.text: With regard to the property at portion 33, farm number 76 Modder B Road, Modder
B in Modderfontein, Ekurhuleni, opposite the Modder B Prison which used to be a
South African National Tuberculosis Association (SANTA) clinic, what (a) is the
present use of this property and (b) are the names of all the occupants currently
residing on this property;
whether rent is being paid for this property; if not, why not;
do the current occupants have permission to reside in the specified property; if not,
what action will be taken in this regard;
what are the future plans for this property?
NW930E

text.b: Mr M Waters (DA) to ask the Minister of Social Development:

page.text: What amount did each province allocate in subsidies to (a) old age and (b) frail care homes
for the (i) 2012-13 and (ii) 2013-14 financial years?
NW931E

text.b: Mrs S P Kopane (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: List the countries that his department has agreements with for the training of medical
students;
(a) when did the agreements come into effect, (b) when will they end, (c) at what
institutions are the students taught, (d) how many students are at each institution, (e)
at what cost per student per year and (f) in what language are they taught;
what are the contractual obligations imposed on the students during their period of
study?
NW934E

text.b: Mrs N W A Michael (DA) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:

page.text: With reference to his reply to question 392 on 4 April 2013, what plans are in place
to ensure that the Medupi Power Plant supply power into the grid by the December
2013 deadline;
(a) who in his department will serve in the monitoring and supervision team at
Medupi, (b) what will their functions be, (c) how regularly will reports be compiled
and (d) to whom will they report;
how regularly will site visits to Medupi be conducted by him;
what is being done to ensure labour stability at the Medupi site;
(a) who is in charge of the one-stop forum for industrial relations at Medupi, (b)
what is their mediation and negotiation mandate and (c) whom do they report to?
NW935E
249 [Friday, 19 April 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Mr T W Coetzee (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: With regard to the Professional Board for Psychology complaint reference number
0055581/456/2007 filed on or about 9 May 2007, (a) what is the status of the complaint and
(b) what has been the reason for the six-year delay in the finalisation of the matter?
NW936E

text.b: Mr S Esau (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: How did the SA National Defence Force (SANDF) assist the International
Committee of the Red Cross (a) before, (b) during and (c) after the battle between
troops and rebel forces in the Central African Republic (CAR);
(a) to whom and (b) how did the SANDF disseminate information in the CAR
regarding the Protocol Additional to the Geneva Conventions of 12 August 1949 and
relating to the Protection of Victims of Non-International Armed Conflicts (Protocol
II) of 8 June 1977?
NW937E

text.b: Mr S Esau (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: How (a) many civilian casualties were inflicted in the battle between rebel forces and SA
National Defence Force troops in the Central African Republic and (b) did the SANDF
facilitate the search for wounded and killed civilians after the battle?
NW938E

text.b: Mr A Watson (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: (a) How many troops from the SA Military Health Service (SAMHS) were in the
Central African Republic (CAR) when SA National Defence Force troops were
attacked and (b) what role did the SAMHS play in assisting wounded troops;
did France assist in the medical aid of injured SANDF troops in the CAR?
NW939E

text.b: Mr D J Maynier (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: What was the total breakdown of cost for operations in the Central African Republic
between 1 January 2013 and 9 April 2013;
what is the breakdown of costs related to chartering aircraft for operations in the
Central African Republic between 1 January 2013 and 9 April 2013?
NW940E

text.b: Mr S C Motau (DA) to ask the Minister of Labour:

page.text: What is she doing to stop fraudulent letters of good standing from the Compensation
Fund;
how many letters of good standing are awaiting to be issued to date;
when will this backlog be cleared?
NW941E
Friday, 19 April 2013] 250
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Mr S C Motau (DA) to ask the Minister of Labour:

page.text: Who (a) are the members of the Treasury Task Team investigating the Compensation
Fund and (b) is its head;
which of these members is responsible for driving her action plan for the
Compensation Fund?
NW942E

text.b: Mrs N W A Michael (DA) to ask the Deputy President:

page.text: What guidance has the Energy Advisory Council given on energy supply during the
upcoming winter;
what concerns has the Council raised regarding the construction of Medupi Power
Station;
what recommendations has the Council made on (a) purchasing private energy and
(b) adding private energy supply to the grid?
NW943E

text.b: Mr A P van der Westhuizen (DA) to ask the Minister of Labour:

page.text: What business software system does the Compensation Fund use;
(a) what procurement process was followed to choose the current system and (b)
when was it implemented;
how much has been paid to date for the current system in respect of (a) software
licences, (b) support development and (c) staff training;
(a) whether the Compensation Fund intends to change its business software system
in the future, (b) how will it be procured and (c) what is its estimated cost?
NW944E

text.b: Mr I M Ollis (DA) to ask the Minister of Transport:

page.text: (a) Which roads will be newly tolled in (i) 2013, (ii) 2014, (iii) 2015, (iv) 2016, (v) 2017,
(vi) 2018 and (vii) 2019 and (b) by what method will each of these roads be tolled?
NW945E

text.b: Mr J F Smalle (DA) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:

page.text: When will the loan between China Development Bank and Transnet be concluded;
what will the loan be used for;
what security was given for the loan;
what are the terms of repayment;
why was China Development Bank chosen for the loan?
NW946E
251 [Friday, 19 April 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Mr J F Smalle (DA) to ask the Minister of Energy:

page.text: When will the 20-year liquid fuels plan be released?
NW947E

text.b: Mr D J Maynier (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: What (a) quantities and (b) type of (i) vehicles, (ii) weapons and (iii) ammunition
were left behind by the SA National Defence Force (SANDF) in the Central African
Republic (CAR);
what is the value of the (a) vehicles, (b) weapons and (c) ammunition left behind by
the SANDF in the CAR?
NW948E

text.b: Mr D J Maynier (DA) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: Whether there were requests by the South African National Defence Force (SANDF)
Commander in the Central African Republic, between 1 January 2012 and the withdrawal of
troops, for additional (a) light-armoured vehicles, (b) light aircraft with reconnaissance
capability and (c) transport helicopters, and, in each case, (i) what specific (aa) vehicle or
(bb) aircraft was requested on each occasion, (ii) what quantity was requested on each
occasion, (iii) why were the requests (aa) approved or (bb) denied and (iv) when were the
requests made?
NW949E

text.b: 742. Mr G G Boinamo (DA) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs:

page.text: Which district municipalities did not achieve the integrated, sustainable and equitable
development as required by section 83(3) of the Local Government: Municipal Structures
Act, Act 117 of 1998?
NW950E

text.b: 743. Mr G G Boinamo (DA) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs:

page.text: Does he intend to outsource (a) water reticulation and distribution and (b) electricity supply
where municipalities did not provide such services; if not, why not; if so, which
municipalities will be affected?
NW951E

text.b: Dr W G James (DA) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:

page.text: What (a) steps will his department take to ensure that poultry brining is properly regulated
and (b) timetable has his department set to effect such regulation?
NW952E

text.b: Dr W G James (DA) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:

page.text: What timeline has she set for the review of the poultry regulations by her
department;
will these regulations be effected in the next 8 to 12 months?
NW953E
Friday, 19 April 2013] 252
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Mrs A Steyn (DA) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:

page.text: Will she give an updated reply to subsection (2) of her reply to question 290 received on 12
March 2013?
NW954E

text.b: Mrs A Steyn (DA) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:

page.text: (a) How much of the R12 million allocated to the Langkloof disaster management fund in
2007 has been spent, (b) on what has it been spent, (c) how much additional money has been
budgeted for the fund, (c) where are the unspent funds being held and (d) what timetable has
her department set to spend its allocated funds appropriately?
NW955E

text.b: Mr R A P Trollip (DA) to ask the Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform

page.text: On what basis has the annual rental of a certain person (name furnished), the current
lessee from his department of the farm De Hoop or Mutton Destiny in the Hofmeyer
District in the Eastern Cape, increased from R33 000.00 pa to R155 000.00 pa;
has his department received any request from the specified person for support in
repairing critical farming infrastructure such as fencing, stock-water provisioning
and irrigation pumping repairs and maintenance; if so, what are the relevant details
as at the latest available date;
has his department (a) allocated this farming operation any mentorship assistance
and (b) received any business plan proposals for this property; if not, why not, in
each case; if so, in each case, what are the relevant details as at the latest available
date;
will he provide (a) an up-to-date, comprehensive report of all infrastructure and
recapitalisation support from his department to the farm De Hoop or Mutton Destiny
in the Hofmeyer District since the lessee took occupation as at the latest available
date and (b) his department’s general policy and record regarding infrastructural
maintenance and recapitalisation of (i) let properties and (ii) the said property in
particular?
NW956E

text.b: Mr R A P Trollip (DA) to ask the Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform

page.text: On what basis has the annual rental of a certain person (name furnished), the current
lessee from his department of the farms Uitkyk and The Flat or Mzinsi project farm
in the Hofmeyer District in the Eastern Cape, increased from R33 000.00 pa to
did he call all lessees and land reform beneficiaries to a general meeting in Gallagher
Estate in 2010 to discuss the terms, conditions and rental payment agreements that
would be applicable to the occupation of State land; if so, (a) have these conditions
subsequently changed and (b) why have they changed;
253 [Friday, 19 April 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013
what steps has his department taken to address the poor state of (a) water, (b) fencing
and (c) other critical infrastructure on farms Uitkyk and The Flat or Mzinsi project
farm in the Hofmeyer District in the Eastern Cape;
what is his department’s policy with regard to properties and farms that are leased to
land reform beneficiaries with regard to the provision and maintenance of
infrastructure and has this been followed by his department in the case of the farms
Uitkyk and The Flat or Mzinsi project farm in the Hofmeyer District in the Eastern
Cape;
has his department allocated a mentor to the farms Uitkyk and The Flat or Mzinsi
project farm in the Hofmeyer District in the Eastern Cape; if so, (a) what are the
terms of the appointment and (b) has his department considered or assisted the lessee
with the implementation of a business plan to make the property a viable farming
enterprise?
NW957E

text.b: Ms A M Dreyer (DA) to ask the Minister of Public Works

page.text: State (a) the name of the consultant and the name of their professional council and
(b) the category of registration for those consultants employed for the service of the
Nkandla project;
list (a) the local planning permissions that have been obtained for the alterations at
Nkandla and (b) in each case, to which part of the project they refer?
NW958E

text.b: Ms A M Dreyer (DA) to ask the Minister of Public Works:

page.text: Whether, with reference to erf 1117 in Bloubergstrand, Cape Town, he can indicate
who owns this land;
what is the current (a) zoning and (b) usage of this land and, in each case, how is the
land (i) secured and (ii) maintained;
what maintenance work has been undertaken since 2010;
(a) what is the name of the security company contracted to protect this land, (b) for
how long and (c) at what cost has the company been contracted?
NW959E

text.b: 752. Mr M Swart (DA) to ask the Minister in the Presidency: Performance Monitoring and
Evaluation as well as Administration in the Presidency:

page.text: In light of the fact that the National Youth Development Fund (NYDA) did not collect 47%
of the targeted R34 million from micro-lenders, (a) from where will the additional funds be
acquired to meet the forecasted budget, (b) have any measures, apart from the operational
costs expenditure targeting communications, been instituted to speed up the collection
process and (c) what steps will his department take to ensure that the full targeted amount
will be collected in future?
NW960E
Friday, 19 April 2013] 254
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Mr T D Harris (DA) to ask the Minister of Finance:

page.text: Will a certain person (name furnished) remain in his position while his actions are
being investigated;
what other complaints has he received regarding the conduct of the specified person;
will he take action against a certain person (name furnished) for his alleged
misconduct?
NW961E

text.b: Mr G G Hill-Lewis (DA) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:

page.text: With regard to the fishing boats that he handed to the fishing cooperatives of Ocean View
and Masiphumelele in March 2013, (a) how many boats did each cooperative receive, (b)
upon which criteria were the cooperatives that received the boats selected, (c) what is the
status of the fishing quotas of each cooperative and (d) what timetable has been set for the
implementation of the Small Scale Fishing Policy?
NW962E

text.b: 755. Mr N J J van R Koornhof (Cope) to ask the Minister of Justice and Constitutional
Development:

page.text: Whether he has found that the recent Judicial Service Commission attempts at
transformation targets (details furnished) are too late and divisive; if not, why not; if
so,
whether his department has developed a systematic programme for achieving these
targets further down the line; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW963E

text.b: Mr P B Mnguni (Cope) to ask the Minister of Correctional Services:

page.text: Whether his department has, since the judgment over the punk style of a certain dreadlocked
official (name furnished), reviewed its dress and hair policy for employees of his
department; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW965E

text.b: Mr L S Ngonyama (Cope) to ask the Minister of Finance:

page.text: Whether the recent Zimbabwean request for a R920 million loan will be granted
despite the reports from pro-democracy movements about the increasing degrees of
violence leading to the 2013 elections; if not, why not; if so,
whether he has considered how this will reflect on South Africa’s human rights
record; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW967E

text.b: Mr L S Ngonyama (Cope) to ask the President of the Republic:

page.text: Whether the Moseneke Report of 2002 on the general election in Zimbabwe will be made
public; if not, why not; if so, when?
NW968E
255 [Friday, 19 April 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Mr D A Kganare (Cope) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: (a) How many volunteers are there who deal with HIV treatment adherence in each
province and (b) what amount of stipend do they get;
(a) what is the average period that these volunteers serve and (b) what is the (i) lowest
and (ii) highest academic qualification of the volunteers;
whether any of the volunteers were appointed as permanent staff; if not, why not; if so,
what are the relevant details?
NW969E

text.b: Mr D A Kganare (Cope) to ask the Minister of Labour:

page.text: How many applications have been made by farm owners requesting to be exempted
from the recently promulgated wage determination affecting farmworkers have been
(a)(i) received and (ii) processed by her department in each province and (b) how many
requests were (i) granted and (ii) not granted exemption;
whether there is any procedure in place for workers to follow in order to express their
views in relation to the application of their employer for exemption; if not, why not; if
so, what are the relevant details?
NW970E

text.b: Mr M G P Lekota (Cope) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:

page.text: Whether his department is training, promoting or involving the youth in matters relating to (a)(i)
broad-scale participation in small business development and (ii) facilitating an understanding of
legislation related thereto, (b)(i) consumer and (ii) corporate regulations, (c) incentive
development, (d) industrial development and (e) innovation; if not, why not; if so, what are the
relevant details?
NW971E

text.b: 762. Mr M G P Lekota (Cope) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and
Traditional Affairs:

page.text: Whether his department had sought and obtained Treasury support to permit certain local
government authorities the right to provide a (a) fully-furnished residence for their
respective mayors and (b) council car for their respective (aa) deputy mayors and (bb)
speakers; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW972E

text.b: Mr M G P Lekota (Cope) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:

page.text: Whether any long-term financial and other support is being given to the families of those
soldiers who had been killed in the Central African Republic;
whether all of the wounded soldiers had been receiving proper (a) medical care and (b)
counseling? NW973E

text.b: Mrs J D Kilian (Cope) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:

page.text: With reference to the electricity supply agreement between Eskom and BHT Billiton,
what are the names and designations of signatories to the renewal agreement in 2001
which extended the initial agreement until 2028;
Friday, 19 April 2013] 256
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013
whether the details and implications of the agreement were (a) provided to and (b)
deliberated on by the Cabinet; if so, (i) when and (ii) what resolutions were taken;
whether (a) a process of due diligence, including short- and long-term implications
and actuarial viability projections was conducted and (b) the results were considered
before entering into the extended agreement; if not, on what basis was a long-term
agreement entered into without such consideration; if so, what are the details of the
(i) motivation, (ii) projections and (iii) deliberations;
whether he will conduct any investigations to determine whether acts or omissions of
a negligent or corrupt nature occurred with regard to this agreement; if not, why not;
if so, when?
NW974E

text.b: Mrs J D Kilian (Cope) to ask the Minister of Communications:

page.text: (a) What disciplinary steps has her department instituted against a certain person
(name furnished), (b) when did the process commence formally, (c) what are the
charges against the said person and (d) when will the matter be concluded;
whether her department consulted the state law advisor on the matter; if so,
whether her department implemented the necessary steps; if not, why not;
whether her department intends to offer the specified person a golden handshake; if
so, (a) why and (b) what amount;
what costs have been incurred so far in relation to the disciplinary hearing, including
(a) the monthly remuneration package paid to this person, (b) the monthly allowance
paid to the person acting in the specified position and (c) associated costs for the
disciplinary hearing and legal advice?
NW975E

text.b: Ms S K Plaatjie (Cope) to ask the Minister of Science and Technology:

page.text: With reference to his reply to question 391 on 18 March 2013, what is the total amount
allocated (a) to the Square Kilometre Array (SKA) pre-construction phase and (b) by each
participating country?
NW977E

text.b: Mr B M Bhanga (Cope) to ask the Minister of Higher Education and Training:

page.text: How many further education and training colleges have received funding for either new
buildings or refurbishments from his department in each financial year since 2010?
NW978E

text.b: Mr P Ntshiqela (Cope) to ask the Minister of Labour:

page.text: How many persons, who were included in the numbers of employed in the most recent
Labour Market Survey, were participants in the Work Programme?
NW979E
257 [Friday, 19 April 2013
INTERNAL QUESTION PAPER: NATIONAL ASSEMBLY NO 12─2013

text.b: Ms N P Gcume (Cope) to ask the Minister of Social Development:

page.text: How many children of school-going age were living in households in relative poverty in the
past three financial years?
NW980E

text.b: Ms N P Gcume (Cope) to ask the Minister of Social Development:

page.text: How many special guardianship orders were made (a) in total and (b) to (i) a relative or
friend connected to the child and (ii) an unrelated person in foster care in the period 1 April
NW981E

text.b: Mr M E George (Cope) to ask the Minister of Police:

page.text: Whether the SA Police Service pays for the private residences of provincial police
commissioners; if so, (a) how many officers are benefiting and (b) what is the total
amount of his department’s bill in this regard;
whether this is standard practice; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what
are the relevant details?
NW982E

text.b: Dr W G James (DA) to ask the Minister of Health:

page.text: In terms of his department’s Regulations Relating to the Reduction of Sodium in
Certain Foodstuffs and Related Matters published on 20 March 2013, does Foodstuff
Category 9 referring to raw-processed meat sausages (all types) and similar products
include chicken which has been subjected to brining; if not, will his department
create a foodstuff category for chicken which has been subjected to brining; if so,
will his department ensure that the brine content in chicken is reduced with regard to
(a) whole chicken carcasses and (b) chicken pieces?
NW983E

text.b: Dr C P Mulder (FF Plus) to ask the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries:†

page.text: (a) Which criteria were used to determine if the Black Association of Wine and
Spirits Industry (BAWSI) qualifies for financial contributions, (b) what was the
objective for which the funds were provided and (c) which measuring instruments
were used to determine if BAWSI achieved the objectives for which the funds were
provided;
whether she has found that the Government’s objectives with the donation of funds
to BAWSI were achieved through the organisations’ usage of the funds; if not, why
not; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW984E

text.b: Mrs C Dudley (ACDP) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:

page.text: Whether her department increased the salaries of matric examination markers as agreed to in
2011; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details?
NW985E
Friday, 19 April 2013] 258

text.b: Mr M M Swathe (DA) to ask the Minister of Public Work: (Interdepartmental transfer

page.text: Whether all municipalities complied with the new incentive grant model of reporting based
on business plans in the 2011-12 financial year; if not, which municipalities did not
comply?
NW834E

text.b: Mr M M Swathe (DA) to ask the Minister of Public Work: (Interdepartmental transfer

page.text: Whether the Expanded Public Works Programme (EPWP) is fully implemented in
Gauteng?
NW835E
